Description: Triangular handle-ornament from a mould-made pottery lamp, decorated with Achilles in a two-horse chariot, dragging the body of Hector past a gate of Troy; Priam and Hecuba look down from the crenellated wall. Light brown clay, covered with a brown slip.
Curator's comments: 'Lexicon iconographicum mythologiae classicae', i, I, p.144, 632. See ‘British Museum Parliamentary Review’ 1895, p.63.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1933)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (876)
Bulas 1929 / Les illustrations antiques de l'Iliade (fig.43)
Birchall & Corbett 1974 / Greek Gods and Heroes (fig.63)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
